description: Three individual reports involving data collection, analysis, graphing, and short-answer questions on materials property-structure relationships. Each report focuses on labs covering materials selection and mechanical properties.

Portfolio with four tasks: camp reflection (4%), industry reflection (4%), academic interview reflection (4%), and conference report/presentation (18%). Develops career awareness, networking, and contextual understanding of materials science in society.

Four topic-based quizzes (10% total) and six online tutorial quizzes (6% total) testing phase diagrams, mechanical behavior, alloys, polymers/ceramics/composites, and fracture mechanics. Includes multiple-choice and numerical questions with instant feedback.
Comprehensive exam assessing all course content via multiple-choice, numerical, and written response questions. Includes hurdle requirement (minimum 40% to pass course).
